Description: Triangular handle-ornament from a mould-made pottery lamp, decorated above an acanthus with a shepherd reclining under a tree, playing the pan-pipes; a lyre hangs from the tree; on the left is a sheep. brown, micaceous clay, covered with an orange-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1938)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (874)
